name: bocardo
params: setvar s0, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2

body.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w0, wn(w1)))
-| wex(s0, wa(w2, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w2, w0))

cumulated.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w0, wn(w1)))
-| wex(s0, wa(w2, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w2, w0))

comment: "Bocardo", one of the syllogisms of Aristotelian logic. Some ` ph ` is not ` ps ` , and all ` ph ` is ` ch ` , therefore some ` ch ` is not ` ps ` . Instance of ~ disamis . In Aristotelian notation, OAO-3: MoP and MaS therefore SoP. For example, "Some cats have no tails", "All cats are mammals", therefore "Some mammals have no tails". (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 28-Aug-2016.)
